001package io.github.ai4ci.util;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004
005/**
006 * Utility class for scaling probabilities using power transformations. Provides
007 * methods to find the appropriate scaling factor k such that the scaled
008 * probabilities sum to a desired target, as well as direct scaling of
009 * probabilities using a given k.
010 *
011 * The main method findScalingFactor uses Newton-Raphson iteration with a
012 * bisection fallback to robustly solve for the scaling factor.
013 *
014 * Example usage:
015 *
016 * <pre>
017 * double[] probs = { 0.1, 0.5, 0.4 };
018 * double targetSum = 2.0;
019 * double k = ProbabilityScaler.findScalingFactor(probs, targetSum);
020 * double[] scaledProbs = ProbabilityScaler.scaleProbabilities(probs, k);
021 * </pre>
022 *
023 * @author Rob Challen
024 */
025public class ProbabilityScaler {
026
027        private static double bisectionSolve(
028                        double[] p, double targetSum, double tol, int maxIter
029        ) {
030                double alphaLow = 1e-8; // Near 0 → sum ≈ n
031                double alphaHigh = 100.0; // Large → sum ≈ count(p_i == 1)
032
033                // Expand upper bound if needed
034                while (computeSum(p, alphaHigh) > targetSum && alphaHigh < 1e8) {
035                        alphaHigh *= 2;
036                }
037
038                for (int iter = 0; iter < maxIter; iter++) {
039                        double alphaMid = (alphaLow + alphaHigh) / 2.0;
040                        double sumMid = computeSum(p, alphaMid);
041                        double error = sumMid - targetSum;
042
043                        if (Math.abs(error) < tol) return alphaMid;
044                        if (error > 0) {
045                                alphaLow = alphaMid; // Sum too large → increase alpha
046                        } else {
047                                alphaHigh = alphaMid; // Sum too small → decrease alpha
048                        }
049                }
050                return (alphaLow + alphaHigh) / 2.0; // Best effort
051        }
052
053        private static double computeMinSum(double[] p) {
054                // As alpha → ∞: p_i^alpha → 0 if p_i < 1, → 1 if p_i == 1
055                double sum = 0.0;
056                for (double pi : p) {
057                        if (Math.abs(pi - 1.0) < 1e-12) {
058                                sum += 1.0;
059                                // p_i = 0 contributes 0 for any alpha > 0
060                        }
061                }
062                return sum;
063        }
064
065        private static double computeSum(double[] p, double alpha) {
066                double sum = 0.0;
067                for (double pi : p) {
068                        if (pi > 1e-15) { sum += Math.pow(pi, alpha); }
069                        // pi ≈ 0 contributes 0 for alpha > 0
070                }
071                return sum;
072        }
073
074        /**
075         * Convenience method with default tolerance and iterations.
076         *
077         * @see #findScalingFactor(double[], double, double, int)
078         * @param probabilities Array of probabilities in [0, 1]
079         * @param targetSum     Desired sum of scaled probabilities (must be in
080         *                      feasible range)
081         * @return Scaling factor k > 0 such that sum(p_i^(1/k)) ≈ targetSum
082         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if inputs are invalid or targetSum is
083         *                                  infeasible
084         *
085         */
086        public static double findScalingFactor(
087                        double[] probabilities, double targetSum
088        ) {
089                return findScalingFactor(probabilities, targetSum, 1e-8, 50);
090        }
091
092        /**
093         * Scales probabilities using power transformation: q_i = p_i^(1/k) Finds k
094         * such that sum(q_i) = targetSum using Newton-Raphson with bisection
095         * fallback.
096         *
097         * @param probabilities Array of probabilities in [0, 1]
098         * @param targetSum     Desired sum of scaled probabilities (must be in
099         *                      feasible range)
100         * @param tolerance     Convergence tolerance (default 1e-8)
101         * @param maxIterations Maximum iterations for solver (default 50)
102         * @return Scaling factor k > 0 such that sum(p_i^(1/k)) ≈ targetSum
103         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if inputs are invalid or targetSum is
104         *                                  infeasible
105         */
106        public static double findScalingFactor(
107                        double[] probabilities, double targetSum, double tolerance,
108                        int maxIterations
109        ) {
110                validateInputs(probabilities, targetSum);
111
112                int n = probabilities.length;
113                double sumOriginal = Arrays.stream(probabilities).sum();
114
115                // Special case: targetSum equals original sum → k = 1
116                if (Math.abs(targetSum - sumOriginal) < tolerance) return 1.0;
117
118                // Compute feasible range [S_min, S_max]
119                double sMin = computeMinSum(probabilities);
120                double sMax = n; // As alpha → 0+, p_i^alpha → 1 for all p_i > 0
121
122                if (targetSum <= sMin + tolerance) throw new IllegalArgumentException(
123                                String.format(
124                                                "Target sum %.6f is below feasible minimum %.6f", targetSum,
125                                                sMin
126                                )
127                );
128                if (targetSum >= sMax - tolerance) throw new IllegalArgumentException(
129                                String.format(
130                                                "Target sum %.6f is above feasible maximum %.6f", targetSum,
131                                                sMax
132                                )
133                );
134
135                // Solve for alpha = 1/k using Newton-Raphson
136                double alpha = solveForAlpha(
137                                probabilities, targetSum, tolerance, maxIterations
138                );
139
140                return 1.0 / alpha;
141        }
142
143        // ------------------------ PRIVATE HELPERS ------------------------
144
145        /**
146         * Applies power scaling to probabilities using given k: q_i = p_i^(1/k)
147         *
148         * @param probabilities Array of probabilities in [0, 1]
149         * @param k             Scaling factor (must be positive)
150         * @return Scaled probabilities array where q_i = p_i^(1/k)
151         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if k is not positive
152         *
153         */
154        public static double[] scaleProbabilities(double[] probabilities, double k) {
155                if (k <= 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException(
156                                "Scaling factor k must be positive"
157                );
158                double alpha = 1.0 / k;
159                double[] scaled = new double[probabilities.length];
160                for (int i = 0; i < probabilities.length; i++) {
161                        scaled[i] = Math.pow(probabilities[i], alpha);
162                }
163                return scaled;
164        }
165
166        /**
167         * Scales a single probability using power transformation: q = p^(1/k)
168         *
169         * @param probabilities Probability in [0, 1]
170         * @param k             Scaling factor (must be positive)
171         * @return Scaled probability q = p^(1/k)
172         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if k is not positive
173         */
174        public static double scaleProbability(double probabilities, double k) {
175                double alpha = 1.0 / k;
176                double scaled = Math.pow(probabilities, alpha);
177                return (scaled);
178        }
179
180        /**
181         * Direct method: scales probabilities to achieve target sum in one call.
182         * Internally finds the appropriate scaling factor k and applies it.
183         *
184         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if inputs are invalid or targetSum is
185         *                                  infeasible
186         * @return Scaled probabilities array where sum(q_i) ≈ targetSum
187         * @param probabilities Array of probabilities in [0, 1]
188         * @param targetSum     Desired sum of scaled probabilities (must be in
189         *                      feasible range)
190         */
191        public static double[] scaleToTargetSum(
192                        double[] probabilities, double targetSum
193        ) {
194                double k = findScalingFactor(probabilities, targetSum);
195                return scaleProbabilities(probabilities, k);
196        }
197
198        private static double solveForAlpha(
199                        double[] p, double targetSum, double tol, int maxIter
200        ) {
201                // Initial guess using geometric mean approximation
202                double logSum = 0.0;
203                int nonZeroCount = 0;
204                for (double pi : p) {
205                        if (pi > 1e-15) { // Avoid log(0)
206                                logSum += Math.log(pi);
207                                nonZeroCount++;
208                        }
209                }
210                double pGeom = (nonZeroCount > 0) ? Math.exp(logSum / nonZeroCount)
211                                : 1e-15;
212                double alpha = Math.log(targetSum / p.length) / Math.log(pGeom);
213                alpha = Math.max(1e-6, Math.min(100.0, alpha)); // Clamp to reasonable
214                                                                                                                                                // range
215
216                // Newton-Raphson
217                for (int iter = 0; iter < maxIter; iter++) {
218                        double sum = 0.0;
219                        double deriv = 0.0;
220                        for (double pi : p) {
221                                if (pi < 1e-15) {
222                                        continue; // 0^alpha = 0, derivative = 0
223                                }
224                                double term = Math.pow(pi, alpha);
225                                sum += term;
226                                deriv += term * Math.log(pi); // d/dα [p^α] = p^α * log(p)
227                        }
228                        double error = sum - targetSum;
229                        if (Math.abs(error) < tol) return alpha;
230                        if (Math.abs(deriv) < 1e-12) {
231                                break; // Derivative too small → switch to bisection
232                        }
233
234                        double alphaNew = alpha - error / deriv;
235                        if (alphaNew <= 0) {
236                                break; // Invalid alpha → switch to bisection
237                        }
238                        alpha = alphaNew;
239                }
240
241                // Fallback to bisection (robust but slower)
242                return bisectionSolve(p, targetSum, tol, maxIter);
243        }
244
245        private static void validateInputs(double[] p, double targetSum) {
246                if (p == null || p.length == 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException(
247                                "Probabilities array cannot be null or empty"
248                );
249                if (targetSum <= 0 || targetSum >= p.length)
250                        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
251                                        String.format(
252                                                        "Target sum must be in (0, %d), got %.6f", p.length,
253                                                        targetSum
254                                        )
255                        );
256                for (int i = 0; i < p.length; i++) {
257                        if (p[i] < 0 || p[i] > 1) throw new IllegalArgumentException(
258                                        String.format(
259                                                        "Probability at index %d is %.6f; must be in [0, 1]", i,
260                                                        p[i]
261                                        )
262                        );
263                }
264        }
265
266}
